abstract: Speaking Monday, the mayor described his sympathy for the residents near the protesters in Zuccotti Park. "The Constitution doesn't protect tents," he said. "It protects speech and assembly."
snippet: Speaking Monday, the mayor described his sympathy for the residents near the protesters in Zuccotti Park. "The Constitution doesn't protect tents," he said. "It protects speech and assembly."

headline.main: Bloomberg Says He Seeks Balance Between Right to Protest and 'Right to Be Silent'
